title: IPL 2025 points table and top run-scorers & wicket-takers
description: The IPL 2025 is in full swing, but who is leading the race for the orange and purple cap? BBC Sport looks at the top run-scorers and wicket-takers in the 18th edition.
excerpt: The IPL 2025 is in full swing, but who is leading the race for the orange and purple cap? BBC Sport looks at the top run-scorers and wicket-takers in the 18th edition.

html:
IPL 2025 points table and top run-scorers & wicket-takers

The 2025 Indian Premier League (IPL) is in full swing.

The key batters and bowlers are starting to stand out in the 18th edition of the world's biggest T20 franchise league.

BBC Sport takes a look at all the key stats - and past winners of the orange and purple caps.

IPL 2025 orange cap: Who is highest run-scorer?

1. Nicholas Pooran (Lucknow Super Giants) - 357 runs

2. Sai Sudharsan (Gujarat Titans) - 329

3. Mitchell Marsh (Lucknow Super Giants) - 295

4. Shreyas Iyer (Punjab Kings) - 250

5. Virat Kohli (Royal Challengers Bengaluru) - 248

IPL 2025 purple cap: Who is highest wicket-taker?

1. Noor Ahmad (Chennai Super Kings) - 12 wickets

2. Shardul Thakur (Lucknow Super Giants), Kuldeep Yadav (Delhi Capitals) and Khaleel Ahmed (Chennai Super Kings) - 11 wickets

3= Hardik Pandya (Mumbai Indians), Mitchell Starc (Delhi Capitals), Prasidh Krishna, Sai Kishore and Mohammed Siraj (all Gujarat Titans), Harshit Rana and Varun Chakravarthy (both Kolkata Knight Riders) - 10 wickets

Previous winners of IPL orange and purple cap

IPL 2025 batting stats: Highest strike-rate, average & most sixes

Highest strike-rate

Minimum 20 balls faced

=1. Priyansh Arya (Punjab Kings) and Vipraj Nigam (Delhi Capitals) - 216.00

3. Nicholas Pooran (Lucknow Super Giants) - 208.77

4. Karun Nair (Delhi Capitals) - 206.97

5. Shreyas Iyer (Punjab Kings) - 204.91

Highest average

2. Tristan Stubbs (Delhi Capitals) - 76

3. Shashank Singh (Punjab Kings) - 63.00

5. Virat Kohli (Royal Challengers Bangalore) - 62

2. Shreyas Iyer (Punjab Kings) - 20

3. Mitchell Marsh (Lucknow Super Giants) - 17

4. Priyansh Arya (Punjab Kings) - 16

5. Ajinkya Rahane (Kolkata Knight Riders) - 14
